alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 05 at 3:59AM PST until March 05 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Storm total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches above 5500 feet. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Storm total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, elevations above 5500 feet, including Cedar Pass on California Highway 299. For the Winter Weather Advisory, Highways 299 west of Cedar Pass, 199, 395 and 139. This includes the cities of Alturas, Canby and Likely. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and snow covered roads, especially after dark. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected from 4 PM PST Friday until 4 AM PST Saturday. Snowfall rates may reach 1 inch an hour between 10 PM PST Friday and 4 AM PST above 5500 feet. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property.
